column4: listen to edbian, I don't want to confuse and I have to get dinner anyway :)
yes, see -A option in « man wget »
you can, yes.  You'll have to use the recursive flag.  « man wget » has some examples.  There's also httrack
-r makes wget recursive.  But you should read through « man wget » to view some examples and to be more familiar with the other wget options
you can type « man wget » in a terminal.  To search the page for the word FOOBAR, you do: /FOOBAR<enter>
because you asked wget not to save those types of files presumably
yes that will only save files that end in "php"
please mind your language and be more patient.
you've asked your question, now please wait patiently.  If someone knows the answer, they'll address you
